answers.answer: One of the main causes of unexplained weight loss is hyperthyroidism.  You should get your thyroid levels tested to be sure your thyroid isn't over producing.  Other symptoms of hyperthyroidism include diarrhea, sweats, tremors, rapid heard rate, heart palpitations, insomnia + others. You need to have TSH, Free T3 and Free T4 tested.There are other causes of weight loss, including diabetes, so you should check with your doctor and get checked out to make sure you don't have any issues...

question: I'm 5'9 and I've weight 117 since I can remember, even after I had my little girl 3 years ago.  Recently I have noticed that I have lost weight.  I know it's not healthy to be underweight to much and I'm beginning to worry that I'm losing to much. I have always had trouble trying to gain weight, but I figured it would happen when it happens.   When should I start worrying about losing to much weight?
title: Lossing weight when that's the last thing I need to do.
